title: Coca-Cola and the Olympics, the alliance of soda and rings
summary: The American giant, the Olympic torch relay's official sponsor, has enjoyed a close relationship with the IOC for nearly a century. Despite health and plastic pollution concerns, the partnership has become so close that it's hard to say who runs the Games.

title: US consumers exasperated by inflation, posing a risk for Biden
summary: Prices remain very high in the US, and consumer spending is declining for the first time since the Covid-19 pandemic, especially among less affluent households. This trend is impacting major consumer groups' finances and tarnishing Joe Biden's record.

title: Chad's junta chief Mahamat Idriss Déby declared winner of presidential election
summary: According to provisional official results, the transitional head of state won this week's presidential election in the first round with 61.03% of the votes on Thursday. His opponent, Succès Masra, is challenging these results.

title: Japan sees an increase in racial profiling of foreigners
summary: Several people have filed complaints against the actions of the Japanese police, claiming to be victims of discrimination.

title: Cartoonist and Bataclan attack survivor Fred Dewilde dies by suicide
summary: Nine years after the November 13, 2015, attacks, the author of several graphic novels depicting his trauma died by suicide.

title: Taylor Swift European tour kicks off in Paris with four shows and 42,000 spectators
summary: As the European leg of the superstar's Eras Tour kicks off on Thursday, fans were already queueing on Wednesday for merchandise.

title: Israel qualifies for Eurovision final amid protest about its participation
summary: Singer Eden Golan performed her song "Hurricane" and secured her spot in Saturday’s final while earlier in the day more than 10,000 people protested Israel's participation in the competition over the war in Gaza.

title: Europa League: Marseille easily defeated 3-0 by Atalanta who reach their first-ever European final
summary: Atalanta will face Bayer Leverkusen in the Europa League final after the German side secured a 4-2 aggregate win over Roma.

title: Artificial intelligence and art: The group trying to get AI to read our minds
summary: Obvious, consisting of a group of three digital artists working on AI, is a project that borders art and science: An exploration of AI's ability to translate our imagination onto the canvas.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Rafah terminal is at crossroads of tense diplomatic game
summary: Egypt and the US did not oppose the Israeli army's return to the crossing point into Gaza, a sign of the discreet negotiations between these two countries and Israel. Yet a military operation in Rafah remains a red line for them.

title: Stormy Daniels denies cashing in on claimed tryst with Trump
summary: The adult movie star concluded her testimony in Donald Trump's hush money trial Thursday after spending roughly 7 1/2 hours on the stand over two days.

title: Paris 2024: How are Olympic torchbearers selected?
summary: The process of selecting 10,000 torchbearers from all over France was rather unclear.

title: Aboriginal Australian children are too often removed from their families
summary: In the state of New South Wales, they account for just 4.5% of the child population, but represented 47% of young people put into care in 2023. The authorities have pledged to reform a child protection system that is now outdated.

title: What do Christians celebrate on Ascension Day?
summary: On May 9, Christians celebrate the Ascension, symbolizing Jesus' ascent to God. Le Monde explores the history and symbolism of one of Christianity's most important feasts.

title: South Sudan mediation talks launched in Kenya with a hope of ending conflict
summary: High-level mediation talks on South Sudan were launched in Kenya with African presidents in attendance calling for an end to a conflict that has crippled the country's economy for years.

title: Boeing 737 catches fire in Senegal, bursts tire in Turkey
summary: A Boeing 737 caught fire in Senegal on Thursday after skidding off the runway, while passengers and crew onboard another 737 in Turkey had to be evacuated after the aircraft's tire burst.

title: Morocco to become rare military drone manufacturer, thanks to cooperation with Israel
summary: Israeli company BlueBird Aero Systems has announced the imminent start-up of a production facility in Rabat.

title: China formally bans 'Glory to Hong Kong' protest anthem
summary: This song, created during the 2019 pro-democracy movement, has often been mistakenly played in international sporting competitions in place of the Chinese national anthem. This confusion is seen as an insult by the regime.

title: Is European identity a myth?
summary: Building a common home has haunted Europe for centuries. Between rapprochements and conflicts, history has offered its citizens a set of widely shared values and ideas, but is it based on this heritage that the European Union can continue to grow?

title: Netanyahu says Israel ready to 'stand alone' after Biden's warning on arms supplies
summary: The Israeli prime minister's statement on Thursday comes after Joe Biden said the United States would not provide offensive weapons for Israel's long-promised assault on the southern Gaza city of Rafah.

title: Armenia: Protestors march against territorial concessions to Azerbaijan
summary: The two former Soviet republics have begun the historic process of demarcating their borders. Four zones are to be returned to Baku, sparking protests in Armenia.

title: A Paris exhibition retraces the saga of the founders of the Renaissance
summary: Paintings, objects and, above all, precious manuscripts with sumptuous illuminations are on display at the Bibliotèque Nationale de France's Richelieu site until June 16.

title: United States adds 37 Chinese entities to trade blacklist
summary: In February 2023, the US Department of Commerce added six Chinese companies to its trade restrictions list following the incident involving a Chinese balloon flying over US territory.

title: Panama president-elect pledges to deport migrants who cross Darien Gap
summary: The Darien Gap, which lies on the border with Colombia to the south, serves as a crucial passageway for migrants traveling from South America to the United States in search of a better lif

title: Hope and despair in Rio 12 years after region's biggest landfill closed down
summary: While nature reclaims its rightful place in the Jardim Gramacho district of the Brazilian city, thousands of 'recyclers' have fallen into poverty since it was closed.

title: Man shoots 2 officers in Paris police station after grabbing gun
summary: The incident happened in the French capital's 13th arrondissement shortly before 10:30 pm and one of the officers' wounds were life-threatening.

title: Protesters gather in support of Israel or Palestine during Eurovision contest in Sweden
summary: While the Israeli candidate, Eden Golan, was taking part in the semi-finals in Malmö, both demonstrations went off without a hitch.

title: At Trump's trial, captivated jurors watch Stormy Daniels remain impassive during cross-examination storm
summary: Donald Trump's lawyer attempted to challenge the credibility and reputation of the former X-rated actress whose sexual relationship with the former president is at the heart of the case.
